content: Not a formal track, but I have heard some interest. Please respond to this thread if you are willing to do some adhoc testing at connectathon.

Note that AuditEvent is one of the things that has been adopted by IHE to support Queries to the ATNA Audit Record Repository, so will be tested next week at IHE Connectathon. There are two systems registered next week at IHE Connectathon.

There was a previous connectathon track on AuditEvent and Provenance. Crucible has retained this test -- for an example, you can see the results of the test on HAPI... https://projectcrucible.org/servers/5543de8a6d6d319267000000#587a692963727522d0000000/connectathonauditeventandprovenancetracktest/CAEP1
After you click the permalink you need to switch to the "Tests" tab to see what I'm trying to link to...
Thanks for the information. I'll check Crucible.
My server's AuditEvent should be pretty good.
And with Subscription, you could track AuditEvent on Grahame's server and get many, many notifications (ask me how I know, haha).
